poem:
Title: Testament in Flame

In the cold shadow of diplomacy's denial,
A torch struck out in the silence.
Aaron's body, an anguished hymn, sung
In the fierce language of fire;
"I am", echoed in the national conscience,
A lone reply, burning clear.
Whence does this obedience respond -
A generation complicit in its ignorance,
Watched genocide, unblinking,
Whilst one gave himself whole,
A beacon's testament within the smoke.
